title: Can we give new accounts 1 free champion?
body:
I was getting a friend of mine into League. They have several champions they would like to play, but instead they have to play whatever crap like Kalista is on free week. Is that really how you want to introduce players to your game Riot? Playing a champion you admitted is broken by design and must be kept weak?

I think after their first game Newbies should receive a free champion token that gets them any one champion of their choosing for free. Because otherwise we are talking 50-100 games to buy their first champion depending on how those games go and what champion they want.

replies.body: Only if they all get a free Mordekaiser too.
So, still 1 free champion?
1 free champion and 100+ free bugs.
coded as minions

You already get 3 (with skin).

-Tristana
-Alistar (defunct - subscribe to League of Legends on Youtube and send a support ticket)
-Garen

https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/202083184-Promotional-Content-Free-Swag-
You would be appalled with how many people don't know about this.
Looking through this thread - and the others like it - I'd say it's worryingly many.
They have champs that cost 450 ip.  suck it up and deal with how the rest of us had to do it.
I own 112 champions and have been playing since 2011 m8

And I own 134 champions, and got 182523 IP right now. Been playing since 2013.

The grind isn't _that_ bad.

I'm sorry what kind of logic is that. Riot shouldn't bring new players into the game with incentives because your butt feels entitled... lol.

> [{quoted}](name=Mira Arya Enthe,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=b00yqOVo,comment-id=000d000000000000,timestamp=2017-01-17T03:42:23.995+0000)

> 
> I'm sorry what kind of logic is that. Riot shouldn't bring new players into the game with incentives because your butt feels entitled... lol.

Receiving a new champion is irrelevant to learning the basics of this game.  The 450 ip champions are some of the least mechanically difficult champions to play in the game.  If they want to learn the game, those champions are the simplest to start with.  If you're going to say oh they deserve a new champion because the grind sucks, then you're basically saying that new players should be given free handouts just because their new.  Then what's the incentive in even grinding this game then? Why not just have everyone make a bunch of new accounts in order to practice one champion then fill the entire queue with people who are smurfing?  Just because new players have a bad time with grinding does not entitle them to free things.  While certainly having a free champion after a certain point like say level 15 or 20 may benefit them, there's often little reason to say that the main reason newcomers to this game are having a bad time is because of the IP grind.  Nearly everyone knows that a large reason why the new player base experience is terrible is because of the higher expectations to know what you're doing when you're playing this game due to so many smurf accounts.  So stop your condescending attitude just because you think oh my friend is like this so everyone is in this situation you condescending prick.

My first 6300 IP champion were Nami (my champion #21).
Lol Fiora is a beast.

>League of Legends Fiora is a beast.

I will freely admit I don't know how to build her properly (which is a rather major part), but also it's just something about how the champion feels to play.

I can't really put words on it, as it's just how Fiora, new compared to old, _feels_.
The old one felt a lot "looser"; had a more "gung-ho" attitude when facing multiple opponents. The new one feels a lot stiffer by comparison. And feels a lot more suited to run home to mommy when facing more than one opponent.

I had some success with the old Fiora: AD, LS and AR pen (and then let the ult do the rest).
With the new one: none, whatsoever. I've tried AD, CDR, AR pen, tanky, AS, even hybrid and crit, and combinations of the lot. Not one of the builds feels "right" for me and my playstyle.
My first was {{champion:89}} back in S2, then {{champion:101}}

Something like that might be OK if it were around level 10. After their first game, newbies don't know what they want. They might think they know what they want, but they really don't. 

Give them a little time so they can at least figure out a few of the things they _don't_ want.

So I decided to go buy a 10$ card and got Akali and Nurse Akali. I played her for a week or two then I was bored one night reading through the other champs and Ahri caught my attention. I really liked her Lore and Abilities so I walked to wal-mart, like 3-4 milies at 5am to buy a RP card to buy her and wouldn't you know it Fox Fire Ahri was on sale too so I got that as well. Ahri and Akali are still two of my favorite champs. But I own everyone know and pretty much play a different champ every game.
